attempts.raw_output:
Complete the following Lean 4 code:
```lean4
import Mathlib

open Filter Topology Real

/--
Suppose we have a necklace of $n$ beads. Each bead is labeled with an integer and the sum of all these labels is $n-1$. Prove that we can cut the necklace to form a string whose consecutive labels $x_{1},x\_{2},\dots,x_{n}$ satisfy \[\sum_{i=1}^{k} x_{i} \leq k-1 \qquad \mbox{for} \quad k=1,2,\dots,n.\]
-/
theorem putnam_1995_a4
(n : ℕ)
(hn : n > 0)
(necklace : Fin n → ℤ)
(hnecklacesum : ∑ i : Fin n, necklace i = n - 1)
: ∃ cut, ∀ k, ∑ i : {j : Fin n | j.1 ≤ k}, necklace (cut + i) ≤ k :=
sorry

```lean4
theorem putnam_1995_a4
(n : ℕ)
(hn : n > 0)
(necklace : Fin n → ℤ)
(hnecklacesum : ∑ i : Fin n, necklace i = n - 1)
: ∃ cut, ∀ k, ∑ i : {j : Fin n | j.1 ≤ k}, necklace (cut + i) ≤ k := by
  use ⟨0, by linarith⟩
  intro k
  have h₁ : ∑ i : {j : Fin n | j.1 ≤ k}, necklace (↑⟨0, by linarith⟩ + i) = 0 := by
    simp_all [Finset.sum_eq_zero]
  rw [h₁]
  linarith
```

Complete the following Lean 4 code:
```lean4
import Mathlib

open Filter Topology Real

/--
Suppose we have a necklace of $n$ beads. Each bead is labeled with an integer and the sum of all these labels is $n-1$. Prove that we can cut the necklace to form a string whose consecutive labels $x_{1},x\_{2},\dots,x_{n}$ satisfy \[\sum_{i=1}^{k} x_{i} \leq k-1 \qquad \mbox{for} \quad k=1,2,\dots,n.\]
-/
theorem putnam_1995_a4
(n : ℕ)
(hn : n > 0)
(necklace : Fin n → ℤ)
(hnecklacesum : ∑ i : Fin n, necklace i = n - 1)
: ∃ cut, ∀ k, ∑ i : {j : Fin n | j.1 ≤ k}, necklace (cut + i) ≤ k :=
sorry

```lean4
theorem putnam_1995_a4
(n : ℕ)
(hn : n > 0)
(necklace : Fin n → ℤ)
(hnecklacesum : ∑ i : Fin n, necklace i = n - 1)
: ∃ cut, ∀ k, ∑ i : {j : Fin n | j.1 ≤ k}, necklace (cut + i) ≤ k := by
  use ⟨0, by linarith⟩
  intro k
  have h₁ : ∑ i : {j : Fin n | j.1 ≤ k}, necklace (⟨0, by linarith⟩ + i) ≤ k := by
    have h₂ : ∑ i : {j : Fin n | j.1 ≤ k}, necklace (⟨0, by linarith⟩ + i) = ∑ i in Finset.Icc (⟨0, by linarith⟩ : Fin n) ⟨k, by linarith⟩, necklace i := by
      apply Finset.sum_bij' (fun (i : {j : Fin n | j.1 ≤ k}) _ => ⟨↑i, by simp_all [Finset.mem_Icc]⟩)
        (fun (i : Fin n) _ => (⟨i, by simp_all [Finset.mem_Icc]⟩ : {j : Fin n | j.1 ≤ k}))
        <;> simp_all [Finset.mem_Icc] <;> omega
    rw [h₂]
    have h₃ : ∑ i in Finset.Icc (⟨0, by linarith⟩ : Fin n) ⟨k, by linarith⟩, necklace i ≤ k := by
      have h₄ : ∑ i in Finset.Icc (⟨0, by linarith⟩ : Fin n) ⟨k, by linarith⟩, necklace i ≤ k := by
        have h₅ : ∑ i in Finset.Icc (⟨0, by linarith⟩ : Fin n) ⟨k, by linarith⟩, necklace i ≤ k := by
          have h₆ : ∑ i in Finset.Icc (⟨0, by linarith⟩ : Fin n) ⟨k, by linarith⟩, necklace i ≤ ∑ i : Fin n, necklace i := by
            apply Finset.sum_le_sum_of_subset_of_nonneg
            · intro x hx
              simp_all [Finset.mem_Icc, Finset.mem_Icc]
              <;> omega
            · intro x _ hx
              simp_all [Finset.mem_Icc, Finset.mem_Icc]
              <;> omega
          have h₇ : ∑ i : Fin n, necklace i = n - 1 := by
            simp_all
          have h₈ : (n - 1 : ℤ) ≤ k := by
            have h₉ : n ≤ k + 1 := by
              simp_all [Finset.mem_Icc, Finset.mem_Icc]
              <;> omega
            omega
          linarith
        exact h₅
      exact h₄
    exact h₃
  exact h₁
```

  use ⟨0, by linarith⟩
  intro k
  have h₁ : ∑ i : {j : Fin n | j.1 ≤ k}, necklace (⟨0, by linarith⟩ + i) ≤ k := by
    have h₂ : ∑ i : {j : Fin n | j.1 ≤ k}, necklace (⟨0, by linarith⟩ + i) = ∑ i in Finset.Icc (⟨0, by linarith⟩ : Fin n) ⟨k, by linarith⟩, necklace i := by
      apply Finset.sum_bij' (fun (i : {j : Fin n | j.1 ≤ k}) _ => ⟨↑i, by simp_all [Finset.mem_Icc]⟩)
        (fun (i : Fin n) _ => (⟨i, by simp_all [Finset.mem_Icc]⟩ : {j : Fin n | j.1 ≤ k}))
        <;> simp_all [Finset.mem_Icc] <;> omega
    rw [h₂]
